title: `forge script` with input parameters, result in application panicked (crashed) error.
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (49f35c7 2022-06-30T00:31:40.009286Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge script

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

I have a script setup as: 
```
function run(address a) public {
  //... do something with a
}
```
And I executed command as 
```
forge script <script-file> --rpc-url <url> --private-key <private_key> --etherscan-api-key <api_key> --boradcast -- <some address, as script arguments>
```
But got errors: 

```
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  Function signature not found in the ABI
Location: cli/src/cmd/forge/script/mod.rs:390

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

```
So now I have to put arguments variable explicitly into script file's attributes in order to execute the script.


Thank you very much for your time and your help.
You have to pass `--sig "run(address)"` for it to understand how to encode the arguments
